author: craigmcc
msg: Update version tags for released packages.

author: craigmcc
msg: Based on conversations on COMMONS-DEV this week, here is the initial crack
at a build.xml file that creates a consolidated commons-combo.jar, and
associated consolidated JavaDocs, for specified CVS tag builds of all
commons proper packages (normally, the latest release tag for each package).
The theory is that, as any Commons packages creates a new release, they would
also update the CVS tag for that package here, and release an updated
commons-combo package as well.
There are a bunch of things left to address -- help is welcome!
* Need initial releases of betwixt, cli, dbcp, discovery, and
validator (right now we're just pulling HEAD branch on these).
* Need final releases of httpclient, lang, and latka (right now
we're pulling interim release tags on these).
* When building the commons-combo.jar file, we need to construct
a consolidated META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file with the correct version
information for all the included packages.  I'm not sure if this
can be automated easily or not.
* Builds of cli and latka are currently commented out -- they both
give me build failures.
* For some reason, the consolidated JavaDocs are picking up only some
of the package.html files describing the included packages.
* Consolidated JavaDocs need an overview.html page that lists the
CVS tags (or corresponding version numbers) of each of the packages
included in this version of the consolidated JAR and Javadocs.
* We should consider creating a consolidated set of the documentation
files as well, not just the JavaDocs.  One issue with just copying
the "dist/docs" output of each package is that they often contain
embedded links to the "api" subdirectory for the Javadocs for that
individual package.  It seems quite wasteful to have two copies of
the Javadocs just to make sure that those links work.
* The build.xml file takes pains to make sure that commons packages
dependent on other commons packages are compiled in the right order,
and against the version of the dependent packages that will be included
in commons-combo.jar.  Unfortunately, the mavenized packages still
compile themselves against the dependency versions declared in their
project.xml files, even if those are different -- leading to the risk
of undetected version mismatches.
New repository initialized by cvs2svn.
